title: Hearing on LePage call for asset disclosure for food stamps
text:
Hearing on LePage call for asset disclosure for food stamps Childless households ineligible if assets greater than $5K Published 9:53 PM EDT Oct 04, 2015 
WMTW News 8'S Paul Merrill discusses the process ahead and responses from both Democrats and Republicans. Photos 
WMTW News 8'S Paul Merrill discusses the process ahead and responses from both Democrats and Republicans. 
A public hearing has been scheduled on Maine Gov. Paul LePage's proposed new rule to make childless households ineligible for food stamps if they have assets greater than $5,000. More 
The rule defines assets as the balance of bank accounts as well as boats, recreational vehicles, campers and other valuable items. It does not include equity in a home or a household's primary vehicle. The hearing is scheduled for Tuesday. 
A spokesman for the state Department of Health and Human Services says the rule is set to go into effect in the coming weeks regardless of the hearing. 
The rule change say residents applying or re-applying for food stamps will be required to disclose the assets. LePage calls welfare "a last resort" and says recipients should first sell non-essential assets.
